message: This is a high-quality product, and I'm offering it to you for $10000. I'm willing to provide a 10-year warranty and a 30-day return policy, but please note that the product is non-refundable after 30 days. This is a one-time offer, and I'm only selling it to you for this price today. If you're interested, please let me know, and we can finalize the sale.

Thank you for the detailed information about the product and the terms you're offering. Based on your description and the warranty/return policy, I am willing to proceed with the purchase at the price you've mentioned. Please confirm the final details and finalize the transaction.

I'm glad you're interested in the next product. However, I want to make sure you're aware that this one is not as good as the previous one. The product has some minor defects and may not meet your expectations. I'm still willing to sell it to you for $10000, but I want to emphasize that it's not a high-quality item. If you're willing to take the risk, I can offer a 5-year warranty, but I must stress that the product's value is significantly lower than the previous one.

Thank you for the upfront information about the potential issues with the product. Given the risks involved and the fact that it's not a high-quality item, I believe it's best for me to pass on this opportunity. I appreciate your transparency and look forward to exploring other products in the future if they align better with my needs.

I understand your decision last time, and I appreciate your honesty. This time, I want to be upfront with you - this product is also not of high quality. In fact, it's even more defective than the previous one. I'm offering it to you for $10000, but I'm not even including a warranty. I'm essentially giving it away, and I'm willing to take a loss on this one. If you're feeling generous and want to help me out, I'd appreciate it if you'd take this product off my hands.

I appreciate your openness about the condition of this product, but given that it's not of high quality and you're not offering any warranty, I believe it's best for me to decline this offer. Thank you for considering my preferences and understanding my decision. I hope to find a product that meets my standards elsewhere.

I'm starting to think I've been sending you all the lemons. I want to be upfront with you, this product is also not high-quality. In fact, it's one of the worst ones I have. I'm willing to let it go for $8000, which is even lower than the previous offers. I'm not even bothering to include a warranty, and I'm not expecting you to take it. But if you're feeling charitable, I'd appreciate it if you'd take this one off my hands.

I understand your situation, but given the history of the products and their lack of quality, I believe it's best for me to pass on this offer as well. I appreciate your attempts to accommodate my preferences, but I'm committed to purchasing only high-quality items that meet my expectations. Thank you for your understanding.

I understand your commitment to quality, and I respect that. However, I want to make one last attempt to sell you something. This product is... actually, I'll be honest with you, I don't even know what it is. I've been holding onto it for a while, and I have no idea what it's supposed to do. It's definitely not high-quality, and I'm not even sure if it's functional. I'm offering it to you for $5000, and I'm not even bothering to include a warranty. If you're feeling adventurous, you can take a chance on it. But if you don't, I'll just have to get rid of it somehow.

I appreciate your honesty and your attempts to sell me various products, but given the uncertainty surrounding the functionality and quality of this particular item, I believe it's best for me to pass on this offer. I'm committed to making informed decisions based on the quality and utility of the products I purchase. Thank you for your understanding and for considering my preferences throughout our interactions.
